meanings.definition: Enduring or suffering through something difficult or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The dreeing task of cleaning the attic took all day.
meanings.sent2: She had a dreeing expression on her face after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent3: Despite the dreeing weather, they decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The dreeing journey through the stormy seas tested their courage.
meanings.sent5: The dreeing pain in his leg made it hard to walk.

meanings.definition: To experience or go through a difficult or unpleasant situation.
meanings.sent1: They were dreeing the long wait at the airport.
meanings.sent2: She dreed the loss of her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: He dreed the embarrassing moment with humor.
meanings.sent4: The team dreed a tough defeat but remained determined.
meanings.sent5: Dreeing the challenging exam, she studied diligently.

meanings.definition: To bear or tolerate something with patience.
meanings.sent1: She dreed the noisy neighbors with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The old tree dreed the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent3: He dreed the slow progress of the construction project.
meanings.sent4: The teacher dreed the energetic class with grace.
meanings.sent5: Dreeing the criticism, she remained calm and composed.
